title.narrative: SWE-2011-157 A systems approach to water and sanitation for the urban poor in Bolivia
SWE-2011-157 A systems approach to water and sanitation for the urban poor in Bolivia

description.narrative: Access to safe water and improved sanitation are key issues for the urban poor in developing countries. It is becoming increasingly evident that the urban poor cannot rely on conventional water and sanitation systems, and affordable, locally adapted alternatives need to be developed. The proposed project aims at supporting the development of sustainable water and sanitation infrastructures for low income households in Bolivian cities. The project will use a systems approach with locally adapted indicators to assess the sustainability of water and sanitation infrastructures in two existing low-income housing cooperatives. An improved system will then be designed for a new housing cooperative and its sustainability will be assessed. The project will involve local community to ensure relevance and acceptability. A handbook will be prepared for future housing developments.
